content: I think the hybrid approach would work best for our family. We can have a sign-up sheet, but also leave some time for impromptu sharing. I'll make sure to designate a few "wildcard" spots for guests who didn't sign up but want to share a story. Do you think it's a good idea to have a theme or a specific aspect of grandma's life that we focus on during the storytelling portion? For example, we could focus on her love of cooking, her travels, or her sense of humor.
